DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-COMPLETO: Jeroen Antonius Maria van de Graaf
DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: van de Graaf, J.;Graaf, Jeroen;VAN DE GRAAF, JEROEN;GRAAF, JEROEN VAN DE

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH:
I am a cryptographer focussing on the theoretical and the applied aspects of cryptographic protocols. I am particularly interested in unconditional privacy, including topics such as: quantum cryptography; protocols based on noise; authentication based on signal reconciliation; election and mixing protocols; general two- and multi-party computation; privacy-preserving data mining etc. Many of these protocol borrow techniques from information theory and coding theory.
I have a Master's in mathematics from the Universiteit van Amsterdam (1985) and a PhD in Informatics from the Universit de Montral (1998). From August 2008 until February 2011 I was an Assistent Professor at the Universidade Federal de Ouro Preto. Since March 2011 I moved to the Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: graduation at Matemtica from Universiteit van Amsterdam (1981), master's at Matemtica from Universiteit van Amsterdam (1985) and doctorate at Informtica from Universit de Montreal (1997). Has experience in Computer Science, acting on the following subjects: election protocols, cryptography, anonymous broadcast, unconditional privacy and criptografia.

DOUTORADO.TITULO-DA-DISSERTACAO-TESE: Towards a formal definition of security for quantum protocols

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Mutual Authentication and Key Establishment from Common Fuzzy Information
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Pairing takes place between two wireless devices and implies two cryptographic tasks: (1) the two devices are told they can trust one another, and (2) a secret communication channel between them is established. Many pairing protocols require user involvement like comparing two random numbers, but simpler options are possible. It is possible to take advantage of the sensors, already available in many devices, which measure various phenomena: sound, acceleration, signal strength for WiFi or Bluetooth, etc. When two devices close to each other measure the same physical phenomenon during the same time interval, the signal measured will be similar, but not identical. This similarity can be exploited as an underlying principle for a cryptographic protocol for Mutual Authentication, and for Key Establishment. The purpose of this research is to implement a prototype of these protocols for Android devices, and to study their security properties leading to quantitative statements about their security.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Mutual Authentication and Key Establishment from Common Fuzzy Information

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-COMPLETO: Jeroen Antonius Maria van de Graaf
INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: van de Graaf, J.;Graaf, Jeroen;VAN DE GRAAF, JEROEN;GRAAF, JEROEN VAN DE

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O objetivo deste projeto a construo de um gerador fsico de nmeros aleatrios (PhRNG, sigla em ingls para Physical Random Number Generator) baseado em rudo fsico gerado por um diodo laser estabilizado em intensidade e operando no regime limitado pelo shot-noise da luz (rudo balstico). Um fotodetector rpido, da classe usada em telecomunicaes, coleta a luz e produz uma sada com a intensidade mdia constante, mas com flutuaes rpidas, incontrolveis e irredutveis devido ao carter fsico aleatrio do processo de gerao da luz no laser. Um conversor analgico digital de alta velocidade discretiza os sinais e os discrimina em valores abaixo ou acima do valor mdio. A sequncia aleatria acima ou abaixo convertida na sequncia de sinais binrios ou bits aleatrios disponveis em sadas de diversas naturezas em funo de sua aplicao.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-COMPLETO: Jeroen Antonius Maria van de Graaf
INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: van de Graaf, J.;Graaf, Jeroen;VAN DE GRAAF, JEROEN;GRAAF, JEROEN VAN DE

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Departamento de Ciencias de la Computacin

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The project general objective is to enlarge and strengthen current joint scientific work between Inria Chile (and its partner the University of Chile) with other research centers in the region of South America, France, and U.K, in the area of Cryptography and Computer Security (data and networks) applied to e-voting and anonymity-enhancing protocols.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Resumo: Neste documento, propomos um projeto para unificar as infra-estruturas de chave pblica no mbito acadmico brasileiro. O objetivo facilitar o reconhecimento mtuo de certificados X509 emitidos por universidades ou outras organizaes acadmicas, assim facilitando a autenticao, autenticidade, integridade e no-repdio nas comunicaes
